intro: Huperzia dixitiana, commonly known as the Mexican huperzia, is a species of fern that belongs to the family Huperziaceae. It is characterized by its spore-bearing structures called sporangia, which are clustered in strobila on the underside of its leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and rocky areas, and is native to Central and South America. Huperzia dixitiana has a distinctive appearance with its lance-shaped leaves and a robust rhizome system. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
